title: Caught In The Middle
opening: In order to speak to the resistance force about the bandits on the Western Isles, Roy and company move west along the coastline. Along the way, they come across a small village caught in conflict. The local lord oppresses the resistance and does anything he can to get rid of them...

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Have you not found that resistance bard yet?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: We have a good lead, milord.

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Out with it then. Where is he?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: He's apparently in hiding in the nearby village.

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Removing Elffin the Bard will sever the brain behind the resistance force. Find him. Burn the village to the ground if you have to!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, milord!

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: I apologize for the wait, Madam Melady.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: You seem to have...a full plate.

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Oh, worry not, our obligations to Bern take priority over all. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: Then let's get to the matter we discussed earlier...

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Ah, the whereabouts of Princess Guinivere.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: Have you found anything, Lord Zinc?

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: I regret to say that I have not. Have you been to Djuto?

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: I have.

intro.speaker: Zinc
intro.line: Then I suggest you pay a visit to Father Oro. He resides in the castle at Mt Ebrakhm to the north. He knows the region better than any of us, so he may have some idea. However, if even he does not know where Princess Guinivere might be, then she is most likely not in the Isles.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: Thank you. I will speak with Father Oro then. Farewell.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The resistance is supposedly very active in this area.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes, that's what our sources say. But I also hear that Etruria's military is hunting down members of the resistance. Their numbers have apparently dwindled.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...Etruria does nothing about bandits but oppresses the resistance? Something is very wrong with this picture...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Indeed it is.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Can we do anything to help the resistance?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Our hands are tied... To do so would directly oppose Etruria's nobility. We are here under Etruria's orders, remember.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I'll send a letter to General Cecilia and see what she has to say. Let's not do anything too rash just yet.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Lord Roy! Etrurian troops are attacking the village to find a member of the resistance force! They're under orders from Lord Zinc, the noble who controls this area.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Oh no!... But should we intervene?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We haven't the time to await General Cecilia's reply... But I want to help the people. ...Even if it means opposing an Etrurian noble.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Lord Roy...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We fight! Our purpose is just! Make Lycia proud!

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Were you able to ascertain Princess Guinivere's whereabouts?

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Unfortunately, no. But a bishop named Orlo in charge of the mines in the north may know.

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Very well. Then we head north.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Galle... I'm sorry. King Zephiel wanted to keep the matter of Princess Guinivere a secret, so only I was assigned to search for her. I'm sorry to get you mixed up in this...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Don't worry yourself.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: But you work directly under General Murdock. Surely you have other duties.

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: General Murdock agreed to allow me to assist you. He thinks it's vital we find the princess and the Fire Emblem.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: ...Do you think Princess Guinivere has the Fire Emblem?

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: That's what His Majesty the king thinks. And I think he's correct, all things considered.

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Come now, don't be like that. I'm sure Princess Guinivere went with good intentions. Let's hurry now.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: You're right...

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: ...Where...am I...?

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: Are you awake?

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: ...What...happened...?

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: We found you lying at the entrance to the village, covered in wounds. We took you home and have been taking care of you.

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: Thank you... But you are...?

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: My name is Mary. I live in this village.

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: ...You live here... Oh no! My very presence endangers this village... ...It may even be too late...

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: I'm sorry?

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: I am Elffin... One of the resistance force. The lord here is sure to send troops in to capture me.

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: The resistance force...

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: Lady Mary, you should leave here. The village is in danger.

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: ...No, I will stay.

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: ...Why?

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: I have a younger brother, but he left with his friend next door to find work. I'm taking care of his friend's sister. I can't abandon her.

battle.speaker: Elffin
battle.line: I understand... The most I can do to protect this village is leave. I thank you again for tending to my wounds. Please take care.

battle.speaker: Mary
battle.line: Yes, you too.

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: What is going on out there? Why is it taking so long to find a single member of the resistance?!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: It's the Lycian Army! They've joined the battle on behalf of the villagers...

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: The Lycian Army? They would betray Etruria?!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Also, milord, we have received a missive from Djuto. They Lycian Army is suspected of working with the bandits. The missive says to take them dead or alive.

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Oh, really? They have ties with bandits? The irony! Those fools only want to save face...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Excuse me, milord?

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: This is not the mainland. The Isles are ruled by might.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: I'm not quite sure I understand...

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Pay it no mind. Was that all the message from Djuto said?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: There's more. Lord Arcard has provided us with reinforcements.

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: What?!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: They should arrive soon.

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Confound it! We won't get credit for defeating Lycia if we're aided by reinforcements! We must wrap this up before they can join the fight... Ah, I've an idea! Get me Scollan!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, milord.

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: You called, Lord Zinc?

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Burn down the village. Kill any who resist.

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: ...Can we take the loot?

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Do as you wish. Just do it quickly.

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: You can count on us, Lord Zinc. Heh heh heh...

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: Gonzalez! Where are you, Gonzalez?!

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: Here... I here...

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: There's a village to the south. With me so far?

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: With you so far.

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: Good. It might be a base for the resistance. Zinc says to burn it to the ground, village and all.

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: Village and all...

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: Good, you understand. Now get goin'! Don't screw this one up, you dimwit.

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: You got a problem? Does your head hurt from thinking too much?

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: N-No...

battle.speaker: Scollan
battle.line: Heh, he's ugly as sin, but he's got a heart of gold. There's nothing wrong with tearin' down a few houses. Are we clear, wretches? No questions?

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: We got it, boss!

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: That's the Lycian Army...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: They were assigned to fight against the bandits...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I know. But Lord Arcard says they're allied with the bandits now. Why they're doing exactly the opposite of their assignment is beyond me...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea, take your soldiers and attack from the north. I'll commence the attack from here.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, sir.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea! Hold on.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, sir?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I hear that you have siblings.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, sir, I have two sisters. One older, one younger.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Are they pegasus knights like you?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: They are, actually. Why do you ask?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I have a younger sister myself...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Any sister of yours must be enchanting.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Yes, she is a sight. I heard, however, she got tangled up in some mess and now she's missing.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: What? Oh my...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I have some people looking into it, but they've yet to find anything. If I didn't have this mission, I would search for her myself.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea, be careful out there. For your family's sake.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, sir. Thank you.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Ready then? Let's move.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Sir, are you sure?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Of what?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Arcard said Ilia's pegasus knights are expendable. They should be fighting on the front line, not us. Surely the lives of us Eturian soldiers are more valuable.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Don't be ridiculous. They are reliable companions. We will attack at the same time...or before them, if need be. Understood?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, sir.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: ...Lord Arcard's story is curious, though... The army from Lycia only arrived very recently. How could they create ties with the bandits so quickly...?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Zinque, the reinforcements from Jutes should arrive shortly.

battle.speaker: Zinc
battle.line: Blast! We have enough problems as it is...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Are you ready? We move southward!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Captain... Are you sure we'll be all right?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Is something wrong?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: The Etrurian army may consider us disposable and send us to the front...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Where did you hear that?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: One of the other riders heard a rumor from the Etrurian army.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Pay no mind to mere rumors.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: But...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: I'm certain Commander Klein would never approve of that.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Do you really think so?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Commander Klein's not like that. I trust him with my life.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: ...Very well. Then we'll trust him as well, for we trust you, Captain.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Good. Let's go!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Excuse me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: W-what you doing?! I am enemy!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: I know... But there's such a look of sorrow in your eyes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: ...There is a village near mountain. You know?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Yes, I know it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: Tell people escape. I have order. Destroy village. I...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: What? Don't! The villagers are innocent...

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: No. It order. I must.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: It sounds to me like you should leave the person who gave you that order.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: Leave?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Yes! You can fight with us. We're protecting the villagers.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: No... I monster... People mean to me... People throw stones... People say "Go away!"... "You a monster!"... Not human...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: That's horrible! Of course you're human! You're a very kind-hearted man. I can tell. Please, come with us. Don't be afraid.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: Me afraid? I never afraid! Everyone afraid of ME! I not afraid!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: No. You ARE afraid. You're afraid that people will throw stones and call you a monster.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: But you don't have to be afraid of us. Everyone in our army is nice. They won't do that to you. Be brave... Take that first step, and you'll never have to be afraid again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Wait! Aren't you an Etrurian commander? Why are you attacking us?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I have specific orders from Lord Arcard to take you down.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Can't you see what's happening here? The people are suffering from the lords' abusive treatment! And you're helping them. You should be ashamed!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Wait. Are you saying that you're helping the villagers?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Yes. The lord here is ransacking the village in search of the resistance. We're fighting to stop him. And you're apparently on his side.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I had no such intention. My orders stated that you were the ones working with the bandits.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: What?! Why would we be working with bandits? We just want to clean things up here and get home to Lycia!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Such nerve.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: What?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Lord Arcard has made a fool of me. I have been so blind enough not to see through his thin veil of deceit.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: ...Do you see what we see now?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I am Klein of House Reglay of Etruria. Forgive me for my misguided attack against you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: I am General Roy of the Lycian Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: General Roy, I would advise you to be cautious. With you against Lord Arcard, I expect him to use every pawn at his disposal to have you dealt with.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Thank you for the advice...

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: If you would allow it, I will join you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: You will?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Yes. I wish to monitor you as an Etrurian commander. I should prove useful as both a fighter and a diplomat.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Klein!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Clarine? You are safe!

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: I'm sorry I left like I did. But I wanted so badly to see you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Oh, the trouble you get into... Well, you're safe, and that's what matters. ...What brings you out here? Did you find a trustworthy mercenary for hire?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: No, I joined the Lycian Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: The Lycian Army?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Yes! My healing staves have been most useful!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...I see. I thought your eyes looked...sharper.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: I'm a lady now, I am.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Let me ask you this. What kind of individual is General Roy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Hmm... He's a tad rough around the edges for a noble... His hair especially is an absolute mess...

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Let me rephrase that. Is General Roy working with the bandits?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: No, of course not! We've been sent here to vanquish the bandits!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: So I heard...

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: The Eturians here are malicious people... It is so embarrassing. Klein... Are you working for them?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: No. Not anymore.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I was sent here to protect the villages. I hereby join the Lycian Army to fulfill my mission.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Klein!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Shall we, then? Will you introduce me to General Roy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Naturally! I love you, Klein.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: T-Thea! Sister!

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Shanna...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: ...I have a contract with Commander Klein of Etruria. Shanna... Are you with the Lycian Army?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Yes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: I see... Then this was inevitable. Draw your lance!

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: No, Commander Klein said he would join us! We don't have to fight!

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: What? Really?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Yes!

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: ...That's a relief. I will join you as well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Thanks, Sister!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Thea!

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Commander Klein! What is the matter?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: There's been a change of plans. We are going to fight under General Roy of the Lycian Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Understood, sir. We shall follow you without question.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I don't mind a question here or there, to be frank.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: We are Ilian mercenaries, sir. We follow our employer's every order. And besides...

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Yes?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: I trust you to make proper judgments.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Thea.

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: ...I have a contract with Commander Klein of Etruria. Shanna... Are you with the Lycian Army?

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: I see... Then this was inevitable. Draw your lance!

boss-talk.speaker: Shanna
boss-talk.line: No... I don't want to fight you!

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: ...Shanna, you know the code of the Ilian mercenaries.

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: Precisely. And we must follow that code, even if it means we must fight our own kin.

boss-talk.speaker: Shanna
boss-talk.line: But...one of us could be killed!

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: I know that! But we must fight! Failing to do so would damage the reputation of the Ilian mercenaries. Our nation can't afford to lose its mercenary contracts!

boss-talk.speaker: Thea
boss-talk.line: Now, draw your lance, Shanna!...Why... Why does it have to be like this...?

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: I wonder how Mary's doing... Her brother and his friend are both traveling, trying to make money. It's too dangerous to go outside now... Can you go check on her? Here, I'll give you this for your trouble...

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: A few months ago, my granddaughter went missing. We all searched in the mountains and found her. She was with a hulking monster of a man, so we threw stones at him to drive him off... Afterwards my granddaughter told me that he was the one who led her to the village. ...If you ever find that man, would you give him this? It's a special axe that's effective against swords. And...tell him I'm sorry.

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: I hate the resistance! We civilians have to deal with the consequences of their actions. You know we stand no chance if we try to stand up to our lord. We just want to lead a normal life. Oh... I'm sorry. I'm just frustrated. I have no useful skills so I can't help you... but take this...

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: ...The resistance suffered a crippling defeat here. Here, take this. I'm going to look for other survivors. There is still hope if we can find our leader.

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: Ah, our heroes! I thank you on behalf of the village. This is made from the scale of a dragon. It's said it will protect the one who uses it from harm. Please, take it.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: It's Wade!

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Hey, Myu! ...Come on, can't you call me UNCLE Wade?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: But... You're just Wade.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Ah, never mind. You look like you've gotten bigger.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Yeah!

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: ...It's dangerous here. Go hide in the hills.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: ...Alone?

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: My sister's still here, right? She'll take you.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Yeah, Auntie Mary's here.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: So she's Auntie Mary but I'm just Wade, huh?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Oh. Here you go.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: What's this? A wing?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: It'll make you like a bird!

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Like a bird? What's that mean?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Like a bird. You know.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: No, I don't know. But, uh, anyway, this is for me?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: No, it's for Big Brother Lot.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: And Lot is Big Brother Lot... Have you got it out for me?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Ha ha ha! I'll go see Mary. Here's the wing. Give it to Lot, OK, Uncle Wade?

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: And NOW she calls me Uncle... Woah, are you OK?! Don't trip...

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Brother! You're home!

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Myu! Have you been a good girl?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Yes, I was good! I didn't even wet my bed!

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: That's my girl.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Lot... While you were away, Mother...

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Yeah, I know... She went to sleep...

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Here... Mother left this for you. She said you might find a use for it.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: Brother... You won't leave me, will you? You won't go to sleep like Mother...?

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Of course not! In fact, next time you see me I'll have a whole wagon of presents. Just listen to Mary and stay good, all right?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: OK!

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Go hide in the hills with Mary. It's dangerous here.

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: I will... And Lot?

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Yeah?

visit.speaker: Myu
visit.line: You promised! Don't leave me!

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: I won't...

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Have you seen my brother? His name is Wade, and he's a mercenary... Have you at least heard of him? Well, take this for your trouble.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Wade!

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Sis! It's good to see you.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: You've returned?

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Well, not exactly... We're here on a mission.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: ...You're never coming back, are you?

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: No! Of course I will! ...Just not yet. Just you wait. When I come back I'll have more money than I can carry. Then all our problems will be a thing of the past.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: I don't care about that... I just want you safe.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Sis...

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: I know how brash and hotheaded you can be, but always remember... There are people who care about you.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Here, take this.

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: What is it?

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: It's a special weapon. I nursed a traveler back to health, and he left it in return. You can use it, can't you?

visit.speaker: Wade
visit.line: Thanks, Sis! I've gotta go now.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Just be careful...

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Mary...

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Lot! You've returned?

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: No... We just stopped by on a mission.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Oh... Myu will be sad.

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Ever since mother died, I've been making you take care of Myu. I'm sorry.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: No... don't be...

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Someday...

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Someday I'll return. ...Can I leave Myu to you until then?

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: ...Can you promise?

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: ... Yes.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Don't lie... You're going to war. There's no saying you'll return.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: But I'll be waiting. Without false hope...

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: I'm sorry.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Oh, take this.

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: What?

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: It's a magic weapon that will help you keep your promise.

visit.speaker: Lot
visit.line: Thank you, I appreciate it. Well then... I must be off.

visit.speaker: Mary
visit.line: Be careful...

boss.speaker: Zinc
boss.line: The people are suffering...? What concern is that to me? They live to serve me. Their wails are meaningless.

boss.speaker: Zinc
boss.line: This is my land... Mine alone... None...shall...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Roy, there is a young man claiming to be with the resistance here.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I'll see him. Let him pass.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: I am pleased to meet you. My name is Elffin. I am a member of the resistance force.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I am Roy of the Lycian Army.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: You have my thanks for saving the village here.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: We simply did what we believe is right.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: But now you stand against Etruria.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Even so, I have no regrets. We may have opposed Etruria's immediate interests, but once the truth about the Isles is out, I'm certain they will understand. I sent a letter to a trustworthy Etrurian noble. If she takes appropriate measures, they will send us aid.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: I would not be so sure...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Why is that?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Don't you find it unusual that Etruria sent you here in the first place?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Actually...yes, I do.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: This is merely conjecture... But was it High Chancellor Roartz and Lord Arcard who requested your help?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...It was.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Why were they so eager to get your army off the mainland, I wonder? Perhaps your presence in Lycia was undesirable to them.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I never even considered that...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: There are rumors...that Roartz and Arcard are working with Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What?! Then Lycia is in danger!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: L-Lord Roy!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Your country may be in peril. Are you free to waste your time on the Isles as you are?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: He's right! Bern wanted us out of Lycia so they could launch an invasion! We must head back at once!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...We stay here.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What?! Why?!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It's difficult to judge what may be hearsay and what may be truth. We can't simply jump on this information and run back to Lycia. I am certainly concerned, but my father and General Cecilia are there. The people on the Isles have only us to rely on.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: That may be, but...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: If we leave without finishing our mission, then all we've done here was for naught.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...Your army is blessed with a wise leader.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Lord Roy, I am sorry for testing you so.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Testing us? So that was a lie?!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: It was the truth. However, I presented the rumor in a way that you might take rash action. Your leader is an admirable individual. I would join you if you will allow it.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I don't like that you tested us. But if you can help, I welcome you. Now then, back to the topic at hand. What can we do to help the people of the Isles?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: You should head south...towards Caldonia.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Why?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Castle Edina is located there. It is where workers are kept before they are sent to Eburacum.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then we must save the people there!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Lord Roy, please take this sword.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What is this?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: It is called a wyrmslayer. It was created during the Scouring to use against dragons. It is effective against wyverns as well.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Wyrmslayer? Is this a legendary weapon?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: No. Legendary weapons can only be used by those whose skill rivals the Eight Legends. This weapon, however, can be wielded by anyone with experience in swordplay.

end.speaker: Mary
end.line: Are you the leader of this army?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, I am.

end.speaker: Mary
end.line: I wish to thank you for protecting our village.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: There is no thanks necessary... We did what we believe is right.

end.speaker: Mary
end.line: Regardless, I want you to have this as a token of our gratitude.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Commander Klein, we will stay and help with reconstruction as directed.

end.speaker: Klein
end.line: Good. These people need you.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Would that we could fight at your side. Here is the bolt we were holding for you. You may need it more than we do. Farewell and good luck, Commander Klein.

end.speaker: Klein
end.line: Thank you. Good luck to you as well.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Captain! We will return to Ilia to make our report.

end.speaker: Thea
end.line: Very good. Thank you for your service.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Oh, and take this... Your sister gave it to me before we left. Please be careful...

end.speaker: Thea
end.line: Thank you. You too.
